activities.loc: Branch 1, Calumet County Courthouse, West Entrance

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ross S. Gerdes

940.19(2) - Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm
940.19(1) - Battery 

Shall maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or illegal drugs. 
Shall not possess any alcohol on person, in residence or occupied motor vehicle. 
No Taverns meaning the defendant shall not enter into or loiter near any establishment where the main purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol, including liquor stores. 
Shall not have contact with A.G. (DOB 9-11-75) or A.H. (DOB 3-12-81).  No contact means no contact in person, in writing, by phone, computer, through a third person or otherwise, except through the defendant's attorney.

Defendant appears by video from Calumet County Jail,
Defendant has not applied to SPD office yet,
Advised of charges & max penalties,
Advised of right to legal counsel,
$2,500 Signature Bond ordered.
